body.p:
List of shortcuts in
Shortcut Action
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + ENTER Moves the cursor to the definition of the referenced XML Schema item.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Click
In Text mode, this shortcut takes you to the definition of a reference.
When you have a multiple selection, this shortcut removes the selection from an item.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + T Opens the Transform with dialog box.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + C Opens the Configure Transformation Scenarios dialog box.
Alt + Enter When the caret is positioned inside an element, selecting this shortcut edits in place the attributes of the element.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Click Make a selection in your document using your caret.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) +Shift + G Finds the references of the selected element in all the topics of the current DITA Map (the DITA Map opened in the DITA Maps Manager view).
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + L Learn Structure.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + S Save Structure.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + N Opens the New dialog box.
CTRL (Meta on Mac OS)+A Selects the entire content of the editing area.
Enter
In the Author mode, opens the content completion list of proposals.
In the Text mode, move the caret on a new line.
In Grid mode, begins editing and lets you insert a new value. Also commits the changes after you finish editing.
In the Transformation Scenarios view, executes the highlighted scenario.
Esc
Disables the Highlight mode.
Closes the current dialog box.
Tab Navigates to next XML node.
Shift + Left Click Moves the image in the SVG Viewer.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Right Click Rotates the image in the SVG Viewer.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + I/Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + O/Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Left Click Zoom in/Zoom out the image in the SVG Viewer
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + T Resets the dimension of the image.
Shift + Tab Navigates to the previous XML node.
Shift Used with the navigation keys, creates a selection area. To extend this area with other nodes from a different part of the document, use the caret and the Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) key.
Up Arrow/Page Up Navigates towards the beginning of the document.
Down Arrow/Page Down Navigates towards the ending of the document.
Down Arrow In the Open/Find Resource view/dialog box, moves the selection to the first item in the results list.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Up Arrow
Scrolls the editor up.
In the Open/Find Resource view/dialog box, used in the search field, this shortcut displays the search history.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Down Arrow
Scrolls the editor down.
In the Open/Find Resource view/dialog box, used in the search field, this shortcut displays the search history.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Right Arrow Navigates to the next word.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Left Arrow Navigates to the previous word.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + [ Navigates backwards to the location of the selected text.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + ] Navigates forward to the location of the selected text.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt +Gl Navigates to the location of the latest edited text.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + NumPad + / Folds all the elements except the current element.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + NumPad + . Folds the elements indented with one level inside the current element.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + NumPad + * Unfolds all the elements in the current document.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Home Positions the caret at the beginning at the document.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + End Positions the caret at the end of the document.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + O In Grid mode, changes the text orientation. The default text orientation is left to right.
NumPad + Plus In Grid mode, expand all the children of a node.
NumPad + Minus In Grid mode, collapses all the children of a node.
Alt + "Letter" On Windows, open the menu access keys.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Space Opens the content completion list of proposals.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + Space The code templates shortcut key.
Alt + Up Arrow Moves the selected node in front of their respective previous sibling.
Alt + Down Arrow Moves the selected node after their.
Alt + Left Arrow Promotes the current node.
Alt + Right Arrow Demotes the current node.
Alt + Shift + PageUp Expands all displayed items.
Alt + Shift + PageDown Collapses all displayed items.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + ] Navigate to the next message.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift +[ Navigate to the previous message.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + F Opens the Find/Replace dialog box.
Alt + Shift + R Rename the current XML schema element.
Alt + Shift + P Renames the prefix of the current element.
F1 Opens the documentation.
F2 Renames resources in the NavigatorProject view.
Shift + Delete In the Project view, removes the selected resource from disk.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Z Undo change.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Y Redo change.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + S Save change.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + H Compare with latest from Head.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + L Learn structure.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + S Save structure.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + . Go to the next error in the Problems view.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + , Go to the previous error in the Problems view.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + NumPad + "+" or Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Scroll Forward Increases the font size with one point for each execution of the action.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + NumPad + "-" or Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Scroll Backwards Decreases the font size with one point for each execution of the action.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS + "+" Increases the font size with one point for each execution of the action. In Grid mode it zooms in.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac Os) + "-" Decreases the font size with one point for each execution of the action. In Grid mode it zooms out.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + 0 or Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + NumPad + 0 Resets the font size to the value of the editor font set in the Preferences pages.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + F4 Makes the current dockable view invisible.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + . Copies the XPath expression of the current element or attribute to the clipboard.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + E Opens the Find All Elements / Attributes dialog box.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Enter Allows you to input multiple lines in the Text to find and Replace with fields of the Find/Replace dialog box.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + N [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Displays the Add SVN Repository dialog.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + E [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Context-depended action that allows you to edit the selected repository location using the Edit SVN Repository dialog. It is active only when a repository location root is selected.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + Shift + B [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Context-dependent action that allows you to change the selected repository revision using the Change the Revision to Browse dialog. It is active only when a repository root location is selected.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + Shift + R [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Allows you to remove the selected repository location from the view. It displays a confirmation dialog box before removal. It is active only when a repository root location is selected.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + Shift + C [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Allows you to create a working copy from a repository directory, on your local file system. To read more about this operation, see the Check out a working copy section.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + Shift + M [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Depending on the selected folder form the repository, allows you to import the contents of a specified folder from the file system into it. To read more about this operation, see the Importing resources into a repository section.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + I [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Imports the files selected from the files system in the selected folder from the repository.
Ctrl (Meta pn Mac OS) + H [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Displays the history of the selected resource. When the operation starts you are able to set filtering options.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + A [Syncro SVN Client shortcut]
Opens the selected resource in the Annotations panel;
Displays corresponding annotations list in the Annotations view;
Displays the history of the selected resource.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + G [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Display a graphical representation of a resource history. For more details about a resource revision graph see the Revision Graph section.
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + U [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Copies to clipboard the URL location of the selected resource.
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + M [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Moves to a specified location the currently selected resource(s).
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + K [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Allows you to lock certain files for which you need exclusive access.
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + K [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Releases the exclusive access to a file from the repository.
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + P [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Displays the Properties view revealing the SVN properties for the selected resources.
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + I [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Provides additional information for the selected resource.
Ctrl + (Meta on Mac OS) + Alt + T Generate/Convert Schema
Ctrl + Shift + "\" (Meta + Shift + / on Mac OS) Generate/Convert Schema
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + Y Enables line wrapping in the editor panel if it was off and vice versa.
Ctrl (Meta on Mac OS) + Shift + G Go to matching bracket.
Ctrl (Meta on MAC OS) + P Displays the page setup.
Alt (Meta on MAC OS) + Shift + F Displays the Quick Find toolbar.
Ctrl (Meta on MAC OS) + Shift + U Highlight component occurrences.
